titleStmt.title: In eundem Aelianum Anglicum, Carmen Ri. B. Cantabr.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: In eundem Aelianum Anglicum, Carmen Ri. B. Cantabr.

monogr.title: A registre of hystories : conteining martiall exploites of worthy warriours, politique practises of ciuil magistrates, wise sentences of famous philosophers, and other matters manifolde and memorable. Written in Greeke, by Ælianus a Romane: and deliuered in Englishe (as well, according to the truth of the Greeke text, as of the Latine) by Abraham Fleming. Seene and allowed
monogr.author: Aelian

div.head: In eundem Aelianum Anglicum, Carmen Ri. B. Cantabr.
div.l: Scripta placent, tamen, interdúm non anté placebunt,
Nec póst, interdúm, quám tibi lecta sient:
Ast vbi sub docto, sub amico Iudice lis est,
Si minús antè placent, póst tamen illa placent.
Laudatur: tribus his non caret istud Opus.
Haec tria vestitus idiomatis anté Pelasgi
At núnc, facundo incedunt ornata cothurno
Laus est danda tibi, FLEMINGE, & praemia danda,
Gratia par reliquis est referenda viris.
